nodes.bodyText: The Eclipse reformatting cleans up some stuff like this.
This is the only new part. We check to make sure we return errors on both E10-386 (root emoji codes) and ^^^
clean up the test. Better results (shouldn't have checked bailey value)
cleaned up this code. Simpler, since we just check the format of the value.
Why are we using the locale code for Quiché here? Do we assume it has no annotations? A comment would help...
Is "E10-836" the root annotation for @cp=\"😀\" ?? This is a bit cryptic...
